Reviews.Title: “Well equiped apartment , close to shopping, food and transport”
Reviews.Author: Jak880266
Reviews.Content: We stayed in these apartments for 3 nights. They were really well equiped, you could self cater if you wish as the kitchen had everything you need to cook a meal. The apartments was clean, spacious and nice. Close to the main designer shopping centre in Berlin and within walking distance of the Zoo and railway stations. We walked to the main part of Berlin where the museums etc. are and it took about an hour. There are trains and buses near by. Loads of restaurants to walk to in this area. Breakfast was great, with a huge variety of food All in all a great place to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, facilities & service”
Reviews.Author: AlfaGuatemala
Reviews.Content: Very well located at 100mt from Ku'Dam, the apartments feature kitchenette, spacious bathroom and neat facilities. The best part: very good price.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mimocita
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for three nights in February 2012. I can warmly recommend this hotel to other Berlin first-timers; it is easy to access the hotel by bus no 109 from the Tegel (TXL) airport. Also, the connections to main tourist attractions work perfectly well, especially if you buy the day travel card (Tageskart) of the public transportation. Breakfast was not included in our room price, but the kichen facilities available in the room and the grocery store cross the street made it easy to prepare one's own breakfast. The room was clean, comfortable and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and clean hotel for a good price but a bit far”
Reviews.Author: Hanit K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a Superior room, which was very clean and in decent size. The room included a small kitchen that was well equipped and included everything you'll need, even a small dish-washer. The brakefast was Excellent and was incleded at the price. The only thing wasn't perfect was the location - the hotel is located 7-8 minutes walk from the U train (Adenauar Platz) so we had to change a train every time. There's a bus stop 4 minutes from the hotel (X10 and more helpfull lines). It wasn't so bad, just that you can find a better located hotels. The buttom line - The hotel was excellent but a bit far from the center

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Comfoprtable in West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: UKbanker33
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for apartment-like accomodation in the slightly "uncool" traditional center of western Berlin. Got an excellent rate on the hotel's site and not sure what I would get. Very welcoming reception assigned me a nice small efficiency with a double bed, kitchenette and small eating area. Well designed and laid out. Clean well outfitted bathroom. Wired internet access (free). I wanted to do selff cater while I was there which was easy with the supermarket across the street. Although many of the city's attractions are far afield, got a transport pass and easily accessed the subway just a block away. The Ku-Damm and Savigny Platz area is loaded with acfes, bars and restaurants although this is no longer tourist central nor does it have the trendy cache of "Mitte" or the older gentrifying neigborhoods in eastern Berlin. For me and ideal place to stay in Berlin in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JMLMTS
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect for our 5 day stay in Berlin. I got a very good room rate from their website (which of course I cross-checked with all the usual hotel websites and it still came out cheapest). Our room (304) was clean, bright and spacious with a nice little kitchenette, big flat screen TV, free internet access, nice big bath (essential after a day's sightseeing), VERY comfy beds and an i-pod docking station for music. The breakfasts were good and were included in our room rate. The location is great - about 100 yards from Ku'damm, with shops, buses, U and S bahn stations all close by. There are literally hundreds of places to eat and drink nearby too. The difficult bit is choosing which to go to. There is a supermarket across the road if you want to "eat in". We are regular visitors to Berlin but this is the first time we have stayed at Citadines. We will definitely use it for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Karl D
Reviews.Content: I recently booked for two days with expedia and extended another day while being there. Room are simple with high speed internet (beware! ethernet cable only, no wifi. I actually had to buy a wifi router to share it with my device) The bed of my room wasn't that great (was actually good for a couch-bed). Service was good. The room was simple and clean and well optimized. The kitchen was obviously very small but functional. The location of the hotel is also fine, it's near a subway station and you can buy groceries in front of the hotel (Kaiser's). One last thing, they have a kind of electronic system to close the room electricity's when your not in it. They tell you to put your keycard in it. Unfortunately, that mean you can't charge your electronics while not being in the room. HOWEVER! I figured that you can put any card half-way in and it works (unfortunately, I only found out about this the last day).

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: podengo
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old daughter and I stayed in a studio apartment here for the weekend. It is a simple but very clean complex and you have everything you need. We had two single beds which were very comfortable. The kitchenette was fully equipped but small, although we didn't use it at all. We were very confused about how to get around but on the 2nd day took a City tour Bus, which goes round in a loop and you can get on and off as you please. It cost 20 euros which was a bargain. We loved Berlin and would certainly return to citadines as a Family but would book an apartment next time for more room. The internet access was useful. We found a beautiful Italian Restaurant called Bernards, which was very reasonably priced and had the best Pizza I have ever had ! Tis was located at Walter Benjamin Platz very close to the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at an apart hotel and we were very happy. Excellent reception after arrival from the close by U bahn station on Adenaurplatz which is a short 5 minute walk away. The rooms are designed for long stays and are equipped with a small kitchen with all the basic equipment and all very handy. Fixed line Internet is included in the room however no wireless beyond then lobby area, for travel I only carry an iPad so wasn't able to connect in the room. The hotel is well located and with easy access to the impressive public transport system so you can get anywhere quickly. It's possible to pay extra and have the bed changed, trash taken out and cleaning done daily if you choose otherwise it's just like home.

Reviews.Title: “Borderline Average”
Reviews.Author: adelaidesurflifesavr
Reviews.Content: Stayed ath this hotel/apartment in July 2011 with a friend. the hotel is clean and located in a safe and quiet area of Berlin. Its 5 min walk to the bus stop and 10-15 mins walks to a tube stop. Does not include breakfast, but has free internet in the foyer on a single computer, sometimes u have to wait a while for someone to get off. The hotel has limited parking about 20 Euros a night, we were very lucky to get the last spot, parking (and driving) in Berlin is hard n expensive. The places i can fault the hotel is that they dont change the towels often, its done (i think) on a random/ ad hoc basis. Also the bed which is an actual sofa/ bed opened up is NOT comfortable at all. I would not go back to this hotel and would recommend people looking for a place to look for a different/better hotel at the "Zoo garden" area, as it is next to a major tube & train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great self service hotel close to the Kurfustendamm”
Reviews.Author: bmh60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 very happy days in this hotel. On arrival in the late evening the reception showed us where the self service laundry was, where the nearest grocery store was and gave the login details for their wifi. Rooms were nice and big with self catering facilities although the hotel does have a restaurant. They also recommended a good restaurant close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value, I will be back”
Reviews.Author: bisnes-and-pleasure
Reviews.Content: Good location: 1 minute from Kurfuerstendamm, 5 minutes or 1 bus stop to Adenauerplatz, about 3 bus stops to Bahnhof Zoo. A decent price for a room with kitchenette and bathroom. Free internet connection (cable provided, not sure about wifi). Friendly receptionists; they printed my boarding pass for free. What I found funny: There is a little window going from the bathroom to the bedroom. (With shades, operated from the bathroom side.)

Reviews.Title: “excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: jonathan6
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Berlin twice before and although all accomodation was very good this was excellent . I had read many reviews which mentioned a sofa bed and was expecting a foam mattress it was infact a bed settee which is fully sprung. The room and all amenities were spotless. We were there for a week so our room was cleaned during our stay and all linen changed. On arrival the reception staff were so welcoming and every time you were either going in our out they were pleasant. They sold the Berlin city card which was useful as you didn't have to go looking for a vendor. The accomodation is the best situated for all forms of transport, the bus stop just down the road. For anyone going to this accomodation take the express x7 bus outside to rudow which drops you at the U Bahn station and then take the U7 to Adenauerplatz and it is a five minute walk from there. I t was the best transfer we have ever had. Purchase a 3 zone ticket in the Airport from the machine for 3 euros which covers your bus & underground. I purely by accident found a great shopping complex which you can get to be getting on at Adenauerplatz and get off 2 stops later at Wilmersdorfer strasse. It is a lovely pedestrian precinct with 2 gret malls, lots of individual shops and famous names such as C&A , T.K. Maxx and would you believe a Woolworths.

Reviews.Title: “clean,comfortable and convenient with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mogiemac
Reviews.Content: the apartment we had was comfortable and clean with the added bonus of a small kitchen so we could make ourselves cups of tea and coffee and more if we so desired and we could keep our beers and wine cold in the fridge. It was reasonable well situated in a good area with plenty of places to eat and drink inthe vicinity. The superb transport system meant it was very easy to get around and the u-bahn was about 5 minutes away. The hotel was very near the expensive shops which were nice to look at even if we didn't but anything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: YAJNA
Reviews.Content: A budget hotel with the comfort of staying in a good location There is no restaurant in this apartment Hotel and not even a coffee shop closely Rooms are very small with a kitchenettes It is a value for money sort of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but the service...”
Reviews.Author: JohnstaCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: The people at the front desk, espacially Mark and Jessica were exceptional. First, the room was clean and tidy, equipped with a microwave, dishwasher, fridge, TV, radio, CD player etc. In addition, there was a supermarket across the street, so preparing meals was extremely convenient. They built with us plans for the day in Berlin and explained exactly, when, how and ways to get to each location. . There is a supermarket over the street. You can also buy breakfast at the hotel. The hotel somewhat away from some main tourist sites. But take the bus 109 from the Olivaer Platz stop a few minutes away on Kurfurstendam to Bahnhof Zoologischer Garten. From there there is easy transport to all the main areas of Berlin. Public Transport is efficient and cheap. The fact that the hotel was located about 400m from a U-Bahn station which doesn't lead to the main stations in town. So we had to take the bus instead, and then switch to the U-Bahn. In addition, the shower isn't completely sealed, meaning that water might spill out if you are not paying attention. Other than that - perfect The hotel claimed they are not responsible for people who smoke in no smoking rooms so I guess we are.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for price paid, although you do pay to have room cleaned!”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: Managed to get this serviced apartment hotel for less than £100.00 for a 3 night midweek stay and for the price paid, I have to say was quite impressed and would seriously consider again if a similar offer came up. Location, well depends on where you need to be in the city really. From Schoenefeld Airport, it takes ages to get to (nearest S-Bahn Station would be Savignyplatz) Nearest U-Bahn Stations are a 10 min walk away (Adenauerplatz U7 or Uhlandstrasse U1) and hotel is off the Kurfurstendamn. For those coming from Tegel Airport, Bus 109 stops nearby. Handy for the Western half of the city, Zoologischer Garten, Kadewe, Kurfurstendamn, Nollendorf Platz, but a trek for anything else east of this. Citadines itself is a hybrid of hotel and serviced apartment.Was allocated a room on the 7th floor which was of a reasonable size at least 30 square metres with a seperate kitchen area. Everything is provided in the kitchen, even down to the number of bin liners, so stock up the fridge and away you go. Bathroom is only equiped with shower gel and soap for the 1st night, as you will need to buy these and towels are only changed once a week if staying that length of time as the whole apartment is cleaned once a week. The room had a sofa bed which according to the other reviews on here created no end of issues. Personally speaking, I found it comfortable to sleep on and had no problem what so ever, the mattress was firm and so were the pillows. Room has free internet access but alas no free wi-fi which is only available in the lobby area from a free 24 hour ticket. One suggestion would be to extend this very valuable facility to the whole of the building. You also need to empty your own rubbish (unless it is a cleaning day) and the rubbish chute is located in the basement along with the parking lot and the laundrette. Staff are friendly and in all was quite happy to stay here and would return, especially If I managed to obtain the same fantastic rate. Perfect for the independent traveller Tip: Avoid Kaisers across the road as it tends to be on the pricer end of German Supermarkets, There is a Lidl and a Netto located about 5 mins walk away in the vicinity of the hotel as you turn left out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel, in an excellent location for everything including many Christmas Markets.”
Reviews.Author: Lucylujane Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Was very clean and well equipped. Room was fantastic with everthing you need for a self catering stay with supermarkets right over the road with everything you need for reasonable price. Can't wait for next year to come back and stay for longer period through Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay for weekend leisure trip to Christmas Markets”
Reviews.Author: Birch253
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this hotel for two nights for visiting Christmas Markets and doing some sightseeing. Had read reviews on Trip Advisor and this sounded a good place for us. We asked for a twin room with proper beds and we got a lovely, clean room that served our every need. The little kitchen was an excellent idea - all hotel rooms should have one! Took advice from previous visitors and got the 109 bus from the airport, which stopped at Olivier Platz, right by Hotel. Got a 3 day travel pass and used the buses all weekend - excellent service. Hotel is out of centre but is quiet and in a nice area just off 'posh' shopping street (Designer stores). Transport is so good you are soon able to get to everywhere you want to go. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for a stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: debst65
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed anywhere like this before when we have gone on a city break. Liked the idea of haaving the freedom to come and go as you plesed. The rooms were clean, warm (V.Important in November!) and well appointed. The only down side was the beds, great idea to have sofa beds, saves lots of room, but they were very uncomfortable!!! Berlin itself was very interesting , the Berlin Wall etc obviously shows the recent past,the Zoo was really good and everywhere was warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for the budget-minded traveler”
Reviews.Author: tudomany
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of a chain and is located in a residential district near the Kurfürstendamm shopping street. It is close to bus and U-Bahn stops, as well as food stores and restaurants. The room included a fully-equipped kitchenette. There are laundry facilities in the basement. My room was small, but very clean. It was in the back of the hotel and quiet. Breakfast, which I did not have the chance to sample, is EUR 10 extra. I slept well on the sofa bed.

Reviews.Title: “After a little hiccup got a terrific room”
Reviews.Author: Lostones
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in October 2010, near the end of a 28 day trip around Germany and the Netherlands. When we arrived we found that we were booked into a room that had a converter bed and was very uncomfortable but a quick call to reception had us in a gem of a room in a fully celf contained apartment. The room was spacious and very modern, as was the bathroom and kitchen. We had been living on bought food for weeks and were very glad to be able to go to the supermarket over the road from the hotel and buy steaks and vegetables to cook up our selves. Berlin is very easy to navigate around and the location of the hotel made it very easy to see everything that we wanted. Staff were very helpful with directions and getting us into another room. Breakfast was included and very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrloiz
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel close to the centre of Berlin, near to the stores and the nightlife of the city. Friendly staff and clean room. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel in the heart of Kudamm”
Reviews.Author: Saeed_Masoudi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely clean and calm. It is at the center of Berlin close to shopping center called Europe Center. The metro and bus connections are also very good, make it easy to visit all the city. We wish to stay there again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “merely perfect- good value- v nice guys”
Reviews.Author: yasso72
Reviews.Content: i spent 10 days with family, price was v good, kitchenette is lovely, v organized and have almost everything u need to do your own food. Kaieser's - a nice supermarket- is across the street. staff is very helpful and cheerful. they answered every question with detailed explanation. the only surprise was that my room had only sofa bed as the main bed and not a bed + extra sofa. i didn't figure this out when booking online. Transportation available all around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: kg26
Reviews.Content: a great apartment style hotel in a good location. plenty of shops nearby. staff are very helpful. rooms are good and the hotel provides free hot drinks and internet at the reception area. got a double room at £45 per night so it was excellent value. metro station is near and the tour bus is a 10min walk. the area around the hotel seems like a safe area. berlin is a great city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DocSweden
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a teenage daughter for five nights. The only thing that wasn´t 100% was the sofabed. I can really recommend this hotel. Very nice and helpful staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: mauridane
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4 nights stay at Citadines Berlin in July very much. Had already tried Citadines in Paris with great succes - and were not disappointed this time either. We got a good appartment on the 6th floor (room 606) overlooking a small square and a view to the TV Tower. There were even fresh flowers in a vase in the living room. The reception is very efficient and we liked the possibility to read newspapers while drinking a free cup of tea or coffee. We used the hotel parking and went round Berlin by S-Bahn (Sauvigny station is quite close). There is a good super market and a bakery just round the corner of the hotel and many cosy restaurants nearby too (Pauls on the corner of Ku'Damm and Schlüter Strasse is great). Free internet in the room if you bring own PC - otherwise in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Nice aparthotel with stylish rooms”
Reviews.Author: mark_chernov
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located near the street K-damm. Staff at reception was very friendly. Our room (studio) was small, but very nice and very clean. There was all that we needed - kitchenette, music player with CD, bathroom with tub. Sofa bed unfolds easily and turns into a very comfortable bed. The hotel gave us more than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Another good Citadines experience”
Reviews.Author: fatboab
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Citadines in Cannes and London we chose Citadines for our 4 night trip to Berlin and we were pleased with the standard and location of Citadines, Berlin. We requested a quiet room high up and were allocated Room 702 and it was ideal. It was on the top floor and overlooking the park and had a good view. I would reccomend this side of the building as the other side overlooks a faily busy street and the room outlooks are into other buildings. The location is not particularly close to the main tourist attractions, ie Reichstag, Jewish Memorial, TV Tower etc. but the transport links are excellent - the bus stop is about 100 metres away with a 5 minute ride to the Zoo railway station then a 5 or 10 minute rail trip to the main tourist sites. There is a small supermarket just across the road for stocking up with milk, cornflakes etc. Again we have been pleased with the Citadines experience and would reccomend their Berlin accommodation. ps Higlight of our Berlin tour was a 'Fat Tire Bike Tour' - a good leisurely city tour seeing the main attracitons of comfy bikes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot in the very heart of (West)Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Vannegen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this special unusual hotel for 3 nights and this was probably the best hotel we have had so far in Berlin (being there quite frequently). First, it is a little unusual for the living item is not just a room but it also has a small fully equipped kitchen which is obviously great for those who want to cook themselves, or have an evening coup of tea without having to leave the hotel. The room itself is big and duly equipped (a big table, two chairs, enough space to move around, etc.). The WC/toilette is a nice surprise, too for it is really spacious and comfortable. The hotel has a free internet spot in the main lobby which is even equipped with a printer. The lady in the morning shift was very nice and helpful. All in all - just a perfect spot. To make it even more just the right choice, the hotel has an excellent location at a nice square, a stone throw from the famous Ku-Damm, and 3 minutes walk from the nearest subway. Needles to say, the variety of bars, restaurants and trendy shops all around is more than you can explore...

Reviews.Title: “A Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: NatashaVV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value and it is in a great location. Just take the 109 bus (2€) from the Tegal airport to Oliverplatz and don't waste your money on a taxi. A very pleasnt surprise here, the area was upmarket just off the Kurfurstendamm which is lined with designer shops. I had a studio room which was still very large and had two single beds together. The room had a bathroom with an excellent powerful shower and a small kitchen. For the money that I paid on expedia £43 per night this was superb value. The staff at reception are friendly and the internet is free. If you are thinking about booking here then don't think about it, just do it because you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Super idea for a hotel - should have more”
Reviews.Author: minoandad Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Located in the West of Berlin a busy bus link to the Zoologischer Garten along the Kurfürstendamm is just 4 minutes walk away. From the transport hub at the Zoo Garten it is easy to reach any part of Berlin. The Reception at staff at the Citadines Apart'Hotel were very friendly and helpful, the room was warm and comfortable, and the broadband connection very good. There was an excellent grocery store just across from the hotel, and a first class vegetable and fruit shop 50m away, so preparing meals was no hassle. Some good restaurants are in the vicinity, if you don't want to bother with self catering. All in all one of the better hotel experiences and one I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel in a good location close to central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dai-derbyshire Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: just off the Kurfurstendam the Citadines is a modern, clean and safe hotel close to U-Bahn stations and restaurants we found it an excellent base for our first visit to Berlin the apartments have a fridge and basic cooking facilities plus a safety box in the room the only negative is the sofa beds (which we left made up as beds throughout our stay)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, What more could you want??”
Reviews.Author: fazza994
Reviews.Content: I visited the Citadines Apart'hotel Berlin in late October. I travelled to and from the apartments by taxi which cost €15 each way. The apartments themselves in my opinion are a very good base to visit Berlin. The rooms are very spacious with a kitchen, lounge and bathroom and even though the bed was a sofa bed it was indeed very comfortable when converted into a bed. The area in which the apartments are located was in my opinion a good area to be situated. There are numerous shops, bakeries and places to eat. In the previous review, it was stated that there are no atms near the apartments however there are some. If you walk out of the main door, turn right and keep walking you will come accross a branch of Deutche Bank which had an atm outside and two inside. Also the previous review stated the shops do not accept card payments this is also not the case. The shop accross the road which can be best compared to a SPAR shop does take cards through chip and pin but the minimum transaction is €10. In my opinion the location of the apartments in relation to the sights of Berlin was also very good. I walked to the main zoo gardens area both days I was there and it only took me 20 mins, from there you can get public transport to anywhere else within the city. To sum up I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again and I would recommend this Aparthotel to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but different style than typical”
Reviews.Author: BrazilBilly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit odd, but not necessarily in a bad way. The rooms are large, have free internet, a full kitchen (even dishwasher!), but the bed is a sofa bed that you pull out, and maid service (fresh daily towels, etc) is not included. From the train station, take any train on platform 16 to the Zoo stop. Then take bus 109 to Oliver Platz and from the intersection you can see the hotel (1 block away with a purple sign). Supermarkets, grocery stores (which do not take credit cards!), and bakeries are all around, though not as much English speakers as other German cities. No ATM nearby, so plan your cash with drawl accordingly. Good business or sight seeing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here. RIP OFF.”
Reviews.Author: zebedee97
Reviews.Content: Tempting, but do NOT stay in this hotel. What a terrible experience! I booked a room with two single beds, but when we arrived we were told that they only had rooms with a sleeper sofa - and not even a normal sleeper sofa (one person sleeps on the tiny sofa and the second person sleeps on a tiny mattress on the floor that you pull out from underneath the sofa). I had to argue with the desk clerk and then the manager before we could get a room with an actual bed and only because I insisted and repeatedly showed them my written confirmation documenting that my room should have two single beds. For 120 euros/night I am not sleeping on a sofa or a mattress on the floor. If I was 18 years old and getting a room for $40 then maybe I'd consider it. If you still want to stay here, then do so at your own risk. You'll need to bring copies of every correspondence or confirmation you ever receive and still run the risk of being cheated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apart-hotel”
Reviews.Author: Efrem_Brazil
Reviews.Content: This place is very well located in a excellent region of Berlin with very ease of access from Tegel with just one bus and a 1 minute walk. The staff is very nice. The room is big enough and has all the equipment need for you to prepare your own meals. There is a weekly cleaning, just as expected being a apart-hotel which was not a problem in my case since i spent all day walking trough the city. There is a direct phone line to your room so everybody can call you anytime. Also, it was the fastest web connection I've found at the hotels I stayed during this trip and totally free.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: grecian1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is in close proximity to the city centre, then you can't go far wrong than staying here. It's very basic but certainly value for money, reception staff are very helpful & speak good english. The dining area is very nice as is the continental breakfast on offer. The rooms are clean but a bit on the small side. However as I said it is certainly value for money & would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love having a kitchen...”
Reviews.Author: torontofashionsta
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Citadines before so knew what to expect. You get a basic room with no daily cleaning. No cleaning is great for those of you who feel they need to clean before the cleaner comes in. Room gets messy but you can keep it messy in peace. Having a kitchen is the real benefit. There is a Kaiser grocery store across the street which was very convenient. Also nice was the free coffee and tea in the lobby. Had 2 beds pushed together - not a sofa bed. Had Internet in the room but Wi-Fi only in the lobby which was strange. Subway is not that close and the line goes nowhere but the bus system is AMAZING in Berlin. Fast and convenient and you get to see the city at the same time. Only a few stops to zoo station which is a main hub to get you around berlin. Location was good but most tourist sights are in the East so was a bit far but still a nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment”
Reviews.Author: aotearoanz
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our apartment at Citadines, Olivaer Platz. It is well equipped and the location is great with bus and underground stops very close by. There are some lovely restaurants just across the road too. We found the staff extremely helpful and pleasant at all times. Shame that the double bed is actually two singles pushed together as they parted company during the night! The apartment was clean on arrival and we were informed that they only clean weekly so we were prepared to tidy up after ourselves. There is a laundry in the basement so towels etc can be washed if necessary. The apartment is a great place to base yourself in Berlin and we would definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Big romm, small breakfast, non existant cleaning”
Reviews.Author: josetrujillo
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin, and decided to stay one more week, after trying to maintain the same hotel (no room available for the period) search at hotel.com, and made one mistake deciding to stay at Cit apt Olivaer Platz. The breakfast is small, awful, do no replenish, Internet line was down 4 of the 7 days, the room is cleaned before your entrance, but only once per week after, you must take care of the bed, and of course do no change bed cloths. For the same money they are much better places. I have traveled to Berlin due to my painting business [--], more than ten times, and that was the worst hotel. The area is good and communications also are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jellybean181
Reviews.Content: We were shocked at the size of the room as there was a dining area, kitchen, living room, bedroom and bathroom. The floor to ceiling windows were lovely as they made the room very light. It was so clean and modern and within easy access to the attractions of Berlin. There are probably better locations to stay in Berlin as we usually had to get a bus or two to the sights but we didn't mind. We had a wonderful 5 night stay here, the only down side was a rude staff member who may have been management who was very condescending to us as a group of teenage girls.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Softgrrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Berlin for weekend short break with three friends. Booked Citadines as I stayed in one in Paris two months ago and it was ok. Citadines Berlin exceeded my expectations. The room was really clean and well laid out. I slept on the sofa bed which was quite comfy. The duvet was also very comfy and warm. The staff were very helpful and informative. The hotel was in an excellent location, close to public transport and shopping. The area seemed very safe. I would not recommend the buffet breakfast. Not much choice and bland. Next door to the hotel is a cozy cafe which made amazing food and coffee - for half the price! When I return to Berlin, this is the hotel I'll be staying at. M, London

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located apart-hotel”
Reviews.Author: Urodoc_72
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the citadines from March 21- 24, 2007. We have a 10-month-old daughter and thought it would be a good idea to book an apart-hotel, with an attached kitchenette. What a find! We got a great deal- about £55 a day. It is very well located- close to the Ku'Damm and a short walk to the Zoo Bahnhof. The room is of a reasonable size, but does get a bit crowded with a baby travel cot! We picked up great take-out meals every night, as we ended up eating in the room because of the baby- there is an excellent italian place across, and a thai/sushi place a couple of blocks away. The only criticism was that although we had asked for a cot while reserving, and had also telephoned the hotel the day before to confirm the same, (since we were reaching the hotel at about 10 PM), they had not provided the said cot. The manager did get us one up about 20 minutes later, but he unfortuantely couldn't set it up that night. In addition, the breakfast bar does get a bit crowded if you reach late. They do provide a high chair for your baby however. The staff in general, is friendly and more than willing to help. I would definitely recommend this place for those visiting Berlin, especially if with small children

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: wagon21
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Citadines Berlin from March 21-25. This is a very modern and clean apartment hotel. This room really is a studio apartment, with a pull out bed, and kitchen. They do not offer and type of maid service if you stay less than a week. The location is fantastic, with a 10 minute walk to the S bahn, and right around the corner from the Ku'damm. The staff is very pleasant and friendly. Overall, we had a very positive experience and I would recommend this hotel for a pleasant stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Matty1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Citadines for 4 nights over the new year. After a couple of weeks travelling through Europe this hotel was a breath of fresh air. All staff were very friendly and helpful, the location was excellent, the hotel was spotless and the room bright and clean. Our room felt more like a modern studio than a hotel room which was perfect. The hotel was also very good value. They've also got a laundry in the basement. We were able to wash and dry our clothes for 9 euros, which is a steal compared to most hotel rates. My only complaint as quite a tall person was that the duvet wasn't quite long enough for me, but this was a minor issue and won't affect most people. Would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location to explore Berlin - just on the Ku'damm”
Reviews.Author: Ursula27
Reviews.Content: best central location possible to find in Berlin to explore attractions great apartment-like rooms modern and light I have stayed there several times over the past ten years always nice and welcome very friendly staff I really love this place - and the rates are very reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: the_trout82
Reviews.Content: Not long returned from a long weekend in Berlin, which my girlfriend booked with First Choice. We stayed at this hotel and it was great. The location of the hotel is perfect for the Kurfürstendamm which has loads of designer clothes shops, Bars, Cafes and Restaurants. Opposite the Hotel there Supermarket, Baker, a couple of cafe's and an Italian restaurant, which were handy. We arrived on a Saturday when there was late-night shopping until midnight, everywhere was still buzzing. The streets were lined with local vendors selling CurryWurst, Chinese noodles, crepes, sweets, beers, cocktails, which created a good friendly atmosphere. It was great. We stayed in a Studio which wasn't huge but it was big enough for a couple. I found it a little strange staying in a hotel room with a kitchen. Couldn't fault the kitchen though, it had a toaster, kettle, microwave, fridge and even a mini-dishwasher! The only bad thing i would say about the room was that it has a sofa-bed, which you have to pull out and fold away everyday/night. The pillows were rubbish and we has 2 single quilts instead of one double, which we didn't like. Our flight home wasn't until the late evening, but the Hotel provides a room where you can leave your luggage because you must check out by 11am, which was very handy. We found all the staff at reception were really very friendly and helpful. The reception area also has free internet access, even if you were limited to about 15 minutes. If you are looking for a hotel close to the centre, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent in a great location beside the main shopping street in West Berlin the Kurfürstendamm with lots of shops and restaurants. There is a supermarket diagonally accross the street from the entrance to the hotel. I was staying with my husband and two children aged 14 and 12. We were given two studio rooms with adjoing doors, this was a great arrangementinstead of a one bedroom apartment as we had two televisions, two bathrooms etc. The kitchens were very well equipped with electric toaster, kettle, dishwasher, microwave oven and fridge. My 14 year old daughter loved the free internet access in the hotel lobby as she was able to contact and talk to her friends back home. On our last day our flight was not until the evening and we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel for collection later. This was very useful. Finally the staff at reception were really very friendly and helpful to us and nothing was ever too much bother for them they were great. I would recommend this hotel and will look to stay at Citadines hotels in other locations in the future. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in a beautiful area”
Reviews.Author: barorna
Reviews.Content: Nothig to add to the previous review. I agree with every word. Spent a wonderful week there in a 2 rooms apartment, The only bug is that the room is cleand just once in a week. If you want it to be cleaned every day, you should add an extra pay of 30 euro per day. For a towel changing it's only 10 euro. I recomment it to all Tripadvisor members and all my freinds.

Reviews.Title: “suites with kitchens, air-conditioned, well-run apart-hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sfterisa
Reviews.Content: Immaculate, well-run apartment-hotel on Olivaer Platz on Berlin's West side. Comfortable, well-furnished suites with equipped kitchens, air-conditioning, laundry in the basement, and free wireless internet in the lobby. The beds fold out from sofas in the studio units, but they are the most comfortable sofa-beds I have ever tried. We never tried the breakfast (charged separately at 8 Euros), as it was easy and inexpensive to equip ourselves with three grocery markets nearby (one of them directly across the street). Dining options in the area were plentiful and quite convenient as well. The apart-hotel is just a couple blocks away from a U stop and bus lines on the busy main street of Kurfuerstendamm, so we found it quite conveniently located. It is extremely secure, with a locked front door you open with your room key. Best of all, when we left a digital camera behind in the room, the staff recovered it and returned it to us! The staff was always helpful and spoke very good English. Very reasonably priced for its quality and features, the Citadines deserves to be discovered by more Tripadvisor visitors. Stellar! Probably our favorite hotel in a six-city tour of major German and Austrian cities.

HotelInfo.Name: Citadines Kurfuerstendamm Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Olivaer Platz 1, 10707 Berlin, Germany
